alert.note: Alert for Bay; Calhoun; Gulf (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 02 at 1:57PM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM CST /3 PM EST/ THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of Big Bend and Panhandle Florida, including the following counties, in Big Bend Florida, Liberty. In Panhandle Florida, Bay, Calhoun and Gulf. * WHEN...Until 200 PM CST /300 PM EST/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1257 PM CST /157 PM EST/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Blountstown, Stonemill Creek, Wewahitchka, Orange, Bristol, Scotts Ferry, Marysville, Chipola Park, Red Hill, Lewis, Abe Springs, Sharpstown, Kinard, Estiffanulga, Frink, Hugh Creek, Chipola Cutoff, Broad Branch and Kennys Mill. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
